messages.text:
Hello golang-dev (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://bradfitz%40google.com@code.google.com/p/google-api-go-client/

It boils down to whether you want the copyright notices
to say "The Go Authors".  If you do, then linking to the
Go files is fine, as is adding people to the Go A+C just
for other repositories (as we will no doubt do eventually
for the subrepos).  If you want to keep this as a "Google Inc"
thing, then you need separate files.  It doesn't matter to me
which one you choose.  Reusing "The Go Authors" is certainly
easier and makes it easier to move code back and forth
if you think that will happen.

I admit that Copyright 2012 The People In The AUTHORS File
does have a nice ring to it.

Russ

I dunno.  If that's easier, but I also want people to be able to contribute
to it in the future who aren't Go authors.

For now I'm just trying to get it to work with Go 1.


On Mon, Feb 6, 2012 at 5:49 PM, <r@golang.org> wrote:

> Do you want an AUTHORS file? If you use the "Go Authors" identifier, you
> would instead share the AUTHORS file from the Go project.
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**5643044/<http://codereview.appspot.com/5643044/>
>
Do you want an AUTHORS file? If you use the "Go Authors" identifier, you would instead share the AUTHORS file from the Go project.

On Feb 7, 2012, at 12:53 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick wrote:

> I dunno.  If that's easier, but I also want people to be able to contribute to it in the future who aren't Go authors.
> 
> For now I'm just trying to get it to work with Go 1.

Sure, but this is important. It needs to correspond to the copyright notices.

-rob

On Mon, Feb 6, 2012 at 6:20 PM, Rob 'Commander' Pike <r@google.com> wrote:

>
> On Feb 7, 2012, at 12:53 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick wrote:
>
> > I dunno.  If that's easier, but I also want people to be able to
> contribute to it in the future who aren't Go authors.
> >
> > For now I'm just trying to get it to work with Go 1.
>
> Sure, but this is important. It needs to correspond to the copyright
> notices.


Currently the copyright notice in the files say:

// Copyright 2011 Google Inc. All rights reserved.

Should I change those to "Copyright 2012 The People In The AUTHORS File."?

... which I guess is: "Copyright 2012 The google-api-go-client Authors." ?

subject: code review 5643044: A+C: add base files.
